threads.label: Wed Feb 11 ¬∑ Enterprise SaaS YTD Summary

tweets.text:
üè¢ AI Impact on Enterprise SaaS ‚Äî 2026 YTD Scoreboard

The numbers are staggering. Here's what's happened in just 6 weeks:

üìâ $285B in enterprise software market value ‚Äî gone
üìä 14% single-day SaaS selloff after Claude Cowork launched
üíº 55,000+ US roles restructured due to AI in 2025 alone

This isn't a correction. It's a repricing. Thread üßµüëá

üîÑ WORKFORCE TRANSFORMATION

‚Ä¢ Salesforce: 5,000+ roles restructured since Sept '25 ‚Äî shifting from support staff to AI engineers
‚Ä¢ Klarna: AI assistant now handles ‚Öî of all customer service ‚Äî doing the work of 700 agents
‚Ä¢ Duolingo: Replaced contract content creators with AI generation
‚Ä¢ monday.com ($MNDY): Dropped 20.8% on guidance as AI alternatives emerge

The "do more with less" era is here.

üí∞ AI REVENUE & HARD NUMBERS

‚Ä¢ ServiceNow: $3.57B Q4 revenue (+21% YoY), guiding $15.5B for 2026 ‚Äî agentic AI platform is working
‚Ä¢ Salesforce Agentforce: 10,000+ customers signed up... then cut staff on the Agentforce team itself
‚Ä¢ OpenAI Frontier: Enterprise agent platform launched Feb 5 ‚Äî orchestrates across Salesforce, Workday, ServiceNow
‚Ä¢ $650B in AI capex committed by Big Tech

The money is flowing to AI infrastructure, not SaaS licenses.

üèÜ WINNERS vs. LOSERS (so far)

‚úÖ Adapting: ServiceNow (agentic platform), Palantir (AIP), Datadog (AI observability)
‚ö†Ô∏è Struggling: Salesforce (spending billions, bleeding stock), Intuit (TurboTax AI fears)
‚ùå At risk: Legacy CRM/ERP without clear AI strategy

The irony? Companies are simultaneously BUILDING AI products and BEING DISRUPTED by AI.

Salesforce is restructuring its Agentforce team while pitching Agentforce to customers. That tension defines 2026.

📋 DAILY RECAP — Wed Feb 11, 2026

Full day in one thread. Safety brain drain, AI disruption trade, $MU breakout, crypto bleed, and a viral essay predicting 50% of white-collar jobs gone. Everything that mattered today 👇

🤖 AI PROVIDERS — DAY SUMMARY

🟢 Anthropic: Safety lead Mrinank Sharma quit warning world "in peril." Super Bowl ad mocked OpenAI. Claude stays ad-free. Opus 4.6 live.
🟠 OpenAI: Ads in ChatGPT testing. Codex 1M+ downloads. $100B round closing.
⚫ xAI: Half founding team gone. SpaceX merger = $1.25T. Elon teases "X Money" financial platform.

📌 Runway $315M raise ($5.3B). Cursor Composer 1.5 (20x RL). Amazon AI content marketplace

💼 M&A & DEALS — DAY SUMMARY

▸ Trump chip tariff carve-out for AMZN, GOOG, MSFT (FT)
▸ Station F European AI accelerator (Sequoia + Mistral + OpenAI backed)
▸ Salesforce ~1K layoffs amid AI pivot
▸ Microsoft superconducting power lines for AI datacenters
▸ Apollo $3.4B chip loan to xAI
▸ $650B AI capex plans across Big Tech
▸ Anthropic + OpenAI both prepping summer IPOs

📈 NASDAQ 100 — CLOSING BELL

QQQ +0.27% — flat finish after wild intraday swings. Hardware up, software down.

🟩 $MU +9.9% (Morgan Stanley PT ↑$450)
🟩 $ON +5.6% | $MCHP +5.1% | $INTC +2.5%
🟩 $NVDA +0.8% | $AAPL +0.7% | $TSLA +0.7%
🟥 $CRM -4.4% (layoffs) | $SMCI -3.9%
🟥 $COIN -5.7% | $MSTR -5.2% | $SHOP -6.7%

📊 CRYPTO — END OF DAY

Day 2 of risk-off. Second consecutive red day across majors.

🟥 BTC $67,640 (-2.2%)
🟥 ETH $1,967 (-2.9%)
🟥 SOL $80.24 (-3.8%)
🟥 DOGE $0.0917 (-1.2%)
🟩 BERA +111% — trending #1 on CoinGecko
🟩 XMR privacy trade still holding

📰 Coinbase launches Agentic Wallets. Anthropic pledges electricity cost transparency.

🔥 HOT TAKE

Today's theme: the AI safety alarm is ringing and nobody's answering. Safety leads quit. A viral essay says 50% of entry-level jobs vanish in 5 years. Bloomberg calls it the "AI disruption trade." Salesforce lays off 1K. And $MU rips 10% because the GPU machine keeps eating.

The market is pricing in a world where AI replaces jobs faster than it creates them. Pay attention.

See you tomorrow at 8:30 AM ET ☕
